intro: Stenogyne viridis, commonly known as the green stenogyne, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the Hawaiian Islands and is characterized by its small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, often covered with a fine layer of hair. Stenogyne viridis is considered a rare and endemic species, facing threats from habitat loss and invasive species.
